N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 105.4 - Registration

State Regulations
(a) Only a vehicle
which qualifies under the preceding section may be registered as a special
purpose commercial vehicle. The commissioner may request a photograph of a
vehicle and other information before issuing a registration. If it is not clear
whether or not a vehicle qualifies as a special purpose commercial vehicle, a
photograph of it and information regarding it should be sent to the Department
of Motor Vehicles, Bureau of Technical Services, Empire State Plaza, Albany, NY
12228 for a determination. (b) A
vehicle, some uses of which are in the special purpose commercial category but
which is also used for other purposes, must be registered as a regular
commercial vehicle regardless of the percentage of use in each
category. (c) No full-track vehicle
shall be registered or allowed to use public highways. No half-track vehicle
with a metal track shall be registered or allowed to use public highways. A
half-track vehicle with a rubber track may be registered under this Part if it
qualifies otherwise. (d) When a
combination of vehicles is registered as a special purpose commercial vehicle, the power unit must always remain with the towed unit. Separate use by either
on the public highways requires separate registrations. Notes
